<p align="center">
    <img src="https://github.com/rose-pine/rose-pine-theme/raw/main/assets/icon.png" width="80" />
    <h2 align="center">Rosé Pine for Ninjabrain Bot</h2>
</p>

<p align="center">All natural pine, faux fur and a bit of soho vibes for the classy minimalist</p>

<p align="center">
    <a href="https://github.com/rose-pine/rose-pine-theme">
        <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/community-rosé%20pine-26233a?labelColor=191724&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,&style=for-the-badge" />
    </a>
</p>

## Theme Strings
- Rosé Pine: ``a6ALTb7ad^c9R<jd7ad^e6ALTf6ALThh=kdnT8bZkT8bZiT8bZjT8bZoT8bZlSmB5mgGi`rW<oHqm\5gpjfnB``
- Rosé Pine Dawn: ``agm[Iboo[ccl^WQdoo[cec\[=fc\[=hEe9inNGFCkNGFCiNGFCjNGFCoNGFClSmB5mgGi`rEYBOqjYddp]6=j``
- Rosé Pine Moon: ``a8b4fb:RLoc>CEBd:RLoe8b4ff8b4fhh=kdnT8bZkT8bZiT8bZjT8bZoT8bZlSmB5mgGi`rW<oHqm\5gpjfnB``

## Usage

1. Copy the theme string for the theme you want to your clipboard
2. Open Ninjabrain Bot
3. Open the `Theme` tab in the settings window
4. Click `Create new theme`
5. Click `Edit` on the new theme
6. Click `Import (Copy data from clipboard)`
7. Save and select your new theme!

## Thanks to

- [lincoln-lm](https://github.com/lincoln-lm)

## Contributing

Modify `template.json` using Rosé Pine variables, then build variants:

```sh
bash build.sh
```

This will build each of the Rosé Pine themes with [@rose-pine/build](https://github.com/rose-pine/build) via:

<!-- #rose-pine-build -->

```sh
npx @rose-pine/build@0.9.1 -t ./template.json -o ./themes
```

_Generated by [@rose-pine/build@0.9.1](https://github.com/rose-pine/build)_

<!-- /rose-pine-build -->

and serialize the themes to the format Ninjabrain Bot expects.

```
rose-pine: a6ALTb7ad^c9R<jd7ad^e6ALTf6ALThh=kdnT8bZkT8bZiT8bZjT8bZoT8bZlSmB5mgGi`rW<oHqm\5gpjfnB
rose-pine-dawn: agm[Iboo[ccl^WQdoo[cec\[=fc\[=hEe9inNGFCkNGFCiNGFCjNGFCoNGFClSmB5mgGi`rEYBOqjYddp]6=j
rose-pine-moon: a8b4fb:RLoc>CEBd:RLoe8b4ff8b4fhh=kdnT8bZkT8bZiT8bZjT8bZoT8bZlSmB5mgGi`rW<oHqm\5gpjfnB
```
